Replace PeerJS with Trystero for P2P networking

PeerJS Cloud \(0.peerjs.com\) was unreliably dropping WebSocket connections,
preventing peer discovery on mobile and desktop. Switched to Trystero which
uses public BitTorrent WebSocket trackers for signaling â€” no server needed.

- Remove peerjs/peer dependencies, add trystero
- Rewrite src/lib/p2p.ts using Trystero room-based API
- Automatic peer discovery via BitTorrent trackers \(no hub IDs needed\)
- Update NetworkPage descriptions for new P2P approach
- Add three-peers-discovery test \(3 isolated contexts, full mesh + data sync\)
- Bundle size reduced from 629KB to 550KB

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")
